thread.title: Let It Shine BEATS The Voice in ferocious ratings battle
thread.title_full: Let It Shine BEATS The Voice in ferocious ratings battle

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Let It Shine BEATS The Voice in ferocious ratings battle
text:
Let It Shine BEATS The Voice in ferocious ratings battle Both shows went head-to-head last night for the first time Share Get celebs   
BBC1's Let It Shine managed to beat ITV's The Voice in a ferocious ratings battle – but only just. 
Gary Barlow's new show gained 6.3million viewers for its very first episode, and received plenty of attention from social media – not all of it good. 
It also took just over a quarter of the total TV viewers for its time slot. 
Meanwhile, The Voice made its ITV debut last night with an all-new line-up of coaches – old hand Will.i.am was rejoined by Sir Tom Jones, who had been let go from the BBC, along with Jennifer Hudson and Gavin Rossdale. Read More The Voice coaches saw a number of hopefuls in its revived ITV format (Photo: ITV Picture Desk) Viewers praised new coach Jennifer Hudson for being so relatable (Photo: ITV Picture Desk) Gavin Rossdale, Tom Jones, Jennifer Hudson and will.i.am make up ITV's The Voice line-up (Photo: ITV) 
It had decent numbers and won the slot for ITV with a 30% market share, but just 5.9million viewers tuned in to watch the latest hopefuls sing for a chance to be mentored by one of the four famous musicians. 
It's a far cry from the ratings the same show used to get on the BBC – a total of 8million watched the series' first episode in 2016, dropping slightly to 7.1million for the 2016 kick-off. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
